topic: gen_dc completes, but shows zero values at all sensor points
body:
Hi Alstan,


Thank you for weighing in here (and apologies for my typo in the
heading--that's a bit embarrassing!).


Good catch on the -ab setting; that makes perfect sense as to why diffuse
contributions would not register, and the suggested values are helpful.


Frustratingly, I fear I still have an issue:
- With -ab set to 0, I receive no diffuse contribution (this is expected
per your note), *nor* do I receive a direct contribution (this is
unexpected).
- With -ab set to 2, I receive no diffuse contribution (this is unexpected)
*nor* do I receive a direct contribution (this is unexpected).
- It's only by making my roof transparent or removing the roof that I
register daylight contributions (direct and/or diffuse based on -ab setting
as you pointed out).


The building has a large window on the south facade, so even with a roof on
the building, I would expect daylight to get to at least some of the
sensors in the space.


My only thought is that my local machine is giving up or failing during the
rtrace process due to -lr set to 0, meaning, as you pointed out, that there
are no limits placed on reflections. But if it's not -ab and not -lr, what
else *might* it be? I can run some experiments if you or anyone has a guess.


Thank you again for your help!


Kerger
